mdRecord.dcterms:title: Harry Adams House, exterior
Harry S. Adams House
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
Wright, Frank Lloyd (American architect, 1867-1959) [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Harry Adams House was the last house designed by Frank Lloyd Wright in Oak Park, completed in 1913. It is a pristine example of a fully mature Prairie Style house to cap Frank Lloyd Wright's Oak Park period. The Harry Adams House has a very low hipped, almost flat roof; a broad central chimney; it rests on a concrete stylobate; and it maintains a long, flat, horizontal appearance. One of the scale backs of the Harry Adams House included using only art glass windows on the top floor. Additionally, the Harry Adams House is the only Frank Lloyd Wright House in Oak Park that has a car port. -- http://www.thefranklloydwrighttour.com/apps/blog/show/5623201-harry-adams-house-frank-lloyd-wright-1913 [work]
